name: servicenow-cmdb
label: ServiceNow CMDB
description: ServiceNow Configuration Management Database (CMDB) is a centralized source that gives you full visibility into your IT environment. By storing information about your organization's infrastructure and how it is configured, this system allows you to monitor your network and ensure stability and best performance.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Specify the URL of the servicenow server to connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: server_url

fields.title: Username
fields.description: Specify the username to access the servicenow server to connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: username

fields.title: Password
fields.description: Specify the password to access the servicenow server to connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: password

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified. By default, this option is set to True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Create Configuration Item
operations.description: Creates a single configuration item (CI) with the specified outbound and inbound relations within the specified Configuration Management Database (CMDB) table.

parameters.title: Class Name
parameters.description: Specify the Configuration Management Database class name. This is the name of the table that contains the desired CI records, such as cmdb_ci_linux_server or cmdb_ci_apache_web_server.
parameters.name: class_name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Configuration Management Database class name. This is the name of the table that contains the desired CI records, such as cmdb_ci_linux_server or cmdb_ci_apache_web_server.

parameters.title: Attributes
parameters.description: Data attributes to define in the Configuration Item record. The available attributes depend on the specified CMDB class. You can locate the available attributes in the associated CMDB table which typically begins with "cmdb_ci", such as cmdb_ci_linux_server or cmdb_ci_mfp_printer.
parameters.name: attributes
parameters.tooltip: Data attributes to define in the Configuration Item record. The available attributes depend on the specified CMDB class. You can locate the available attributes in the associated CMDB table which typically begins with "cmdb_ci", such as cmdb_ci_linux_server or cmdb_ci_mfp_printer.

parameters.title: Discovery Source
parameters.description: Entity that updated the information. This must be one of the choice values specified in the option field.
parameters.name: source
parameters.tooltip: Entity that updated the information. This must be one of the choice values specified in the option field.

parameters.title: Inbound Relations
parameters.description: (Optional) List of objects that define the inbound relations to associate with the Configuration Item.
parameters.name: inbound_relations
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) List of objects that define the inbound relations to associate with the Configuration Item.

parameters.title: Outbound Relations
parameters.description: (Optional) List of objects that define the outbound relations to associate with the Configuration Item.
parameters.name: outbound_relations
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) List of objects that define the outbound relations to associate with the Configuration Item.

operations.title: Get Configuration Items
operations.description: Retrieves the available configuration items (CI) for a specified Configuration Management Database (CMDB) class (table).

parameters.title: Class Name
parameters.description: Specify the Configuration Management Database class name based on which you want to retrieve available configuration items (CI) for a specified Configuration Management Database.
parameters.name: class_name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Configuration Management Database class name based on which you want to retrieve available configuration items (CI) for a specified Configuration Management Database.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Query using which you want to filter configuration items (CI) for a specified Configuration Management Database. Syntax: <col_name><operator><value> For e.g. javascript:gs.getUserID()^active=true, etc.
parameters.name: sysparm_query
parameters.description: (Optional) Query using which you want to filter configuration items (CI) for a specified Configuration Management Database.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return. By default, this option is set as 1000.
parameters.name: sysparm_limit
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) The maximum number of records to return. By default, this option is set as 1000

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Index of the first item to be returned by this operation. This parameter is useful for pagination and for getting a subset of items. By default, this is set as 0
parameters.name: sysparm_offset
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) The number of records to skip past. By default, this option is set as 0
